description: Numbers n such that 2*3^n + 1 is prime.
references: Wilfrid Keller and Jorg Richstein, Solutions of the congruence a^(p-1) = 1 (mod p^r), Math. Comp., Vol. 74 (2005), 927-936.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
H. C. Williams and C. R. Zarnke, Some prime numbers of the forms 2*3^n+1 and 2*3^n-1, Math. Comp., 26 (1972), 995-998.
mathematica: lst={};Do[If[PrimeQ[2*3^n+1], AppendTo[lst, n]], {n, 0, 10^4}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Aug 19 2008 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A056802 (n such that 2*9^n + 1 is prime).
Cf. A111974 (primes of the form 2*3^n+1), A003307 (n such that 2*3^n-1 is prime).
